detaileddescription.para: String containing the CVS revision. Read out via reflection!
Calculator for dynamically determining the mutation rate. If set to null the value of m_mutationRate will be used. Replaces the previously used boolean m_dynamicMutationRate.

Constructs a new instance of this MutationOperator without a specified mutation rate, which results in dynamic mutation being turned on. This means that the mutation rate will be automatically determined by this operator based upon the number of genes present in the chromosomes.
Attention: The configuration used is the one set with the static method Genotype.setConfiguration.

Constructs a new instance of this MutationOperator with a specified mutation rate calculator, which results in dynamic mutation being turned on.
a_config
the configuration to use
a_mutationRateCalculator
calculator for dynamic mutation rate computation
InvalidConfigurationException
Klaus Meffert
1.1
Constructs a new instance of this MutationOperator with the given mutation rate.

parameterdescription.para: desired rate of mutation, expressed as the denominator of the 1 / X fraction. For example, 1000 would result in 1/1000 genes being mutated on average. A mutation rate of zero disables mutation entirely

the population of chromosomes from the current evolution prior to exposure to any genetic operators. Chromosomes in this array should not be modified. Please notice, that the call in Genotype.evolve() to the implementations of GeneticOperator overgoes this due to performance issues
the pool of chromosomes that have been mutated

detaileddescription.para: Sets the MutationRateCalculator to be used for determining the strength of mutation.

parameterdescription.para: new rate of mutation, expressed as the denominator of the 1 / X fraction. For example, 1000 would result in 1/1000 genes being mutated on average. A mutation rate of zero disables mutation entirely

detaileddescription.para: Compares this GeneticOperator against the specified object. The result is true if and the argument is an instance of this class and is equal wrt the data.

simplesect.para: true: if the objects are the same, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Compares the given GeneticOperator to this GeneticOperator.

parameterdescription.para: the instance against which to compare this instance

simplesect.para: a negative number if this instance is "less than" the given instance, zero if they are equal to each other, and a positive number if this is "greater than" the given instance

detaileddescription.para: Helper: mutate all atomic elements of a gene.

parameterdescription.para: the generator delivering the amount of mutation

detaileddescription.para: The mutation operator runs through the genes in each of the Chromosomes in the population and mutates them in statistical accordance to the given mutation rate. Mutated Chromosomes are then added to the list of candidate Chromosomes destined for the natural selection process.

This MutationOperator supports both fixed and dynamic mutation rates. A fixed rate is one specified at construction time by the user. A dynamic rate is determined by this class if no fixed rate is provided, and is calculated based on the size of the Chromosomes in the population. Details are specified in the DefaultMutationRateCalculator class.
